result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Cline Smith II

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF343, 22CF36, 22CF57, 22CF414, and 22CF192. State notes that no victims plan to attend the hearings today. In 22CF343, Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests a status. Attorney Rosenthal notes that the defendant just finished an assessment in Duluth. There is a joint request for another status.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:58 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's demand for discovery and inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.

1:38 PM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal appeared by video for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $3000 cash bail. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. State notes pending cases in this county. Recites bail jumping allegations in pending files. State reviews previous bail set and posted by this court as well as reductions of bail. State asks for cash to ensure compliance with court orders. State recites defendant's previous criminal convictions and FTAs. Attorney Rosenthal indicates defendant is a lifelong resident and has significant ties to the area. Notes that there is already $5800 posted across open files. Notes that this pending case is a low level offense. Asks for reasonable cash bail, notes maximum fine for this offense would be $300. Defendant can post up to $500. Court notes concerns over the number of pending cases and criminal history and FTAs. Notes concerns over committing new offenses while out on bail. 
Court orders $1500 cash. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
